text: Push down through the clouds to the island town of Swallo Falls, and down into the elementary school classroom.

Have you ever felt like you were a little bit different? Like you had something unique to offer the world, if you could just get people to see it? Then you know exactly how it felt... INT. CLASSROOM -— DAY PUSH IN on a raised hand from the back of the classroom. This is YOUNG FLINT. 8, unkempt hair, “frogs!” T-shirt.
..-To be me.
Go ahead, Flint. Young Flint steps to the front and addresses the class.

(NERVOUSLY) What is the number one problem facing our community today? Untied shoelaces. The children, all with untied shoelaces, stare at him. YOUNG FLINT (CONT’D) Which is why I’ve invented a laceless alternative foot covering, Spray-On Shoes.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 2. He sprays the can on his feet. The other kids look impressed.
Wow! / Whoa!
Voila! Then, the class bully, YOUNG BRENT, pipes up.

How're you gonna get ‘em off, nerd? Uh-oh. The kids LAUGH as young Flint tugs and strains to take off the shoes, but they won’t come off. YOUNG BRENT (CONT’D) What a geek! He wants to be smart, but that’s lame! On Flint, flailing, upset.
Flint runs down the empty street, crying in the rain.

I wanted to run away that day... but you can’t run away from your own feet. INT. FLINT’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Flint, SNIFFLING, tries to BITE his shoes off, but it doe nothing. Then he pulls out a SCREWDRIVER. It breaks in half. SCISSORS bend around his foot. A CINDER BLOCK crack in half. These things are indestructible.
TIM, Flint’s gruff blue-collar dad, and FRAN, his warm mother, approach the door. Fran gestures for Tim to speak
Uh... Not every sardine jumps in the net, son.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 3.
I don’t understand fishing metaphors! Flint flops on the bed.
What did I say?
Don't worry. Fran opens the door.
Honey, I think your shoes are wonderful. She enters and sits on the bed as Flint hides his face in pillow.
Everyone just thinks I’m a weirdo. Fran gestures to Flint’s wall of posters of great invento Tesla, Farnsworth, Edison, etc.

So? People probably thought that these guys were weirdos too! But that never stopped them. (THEN) I was saving this for your birthday, but, here... With a sly smile she holds up an adult-size LAB COAT.
(GASPS) A professional-grade lab coat. Just like the real guys wear! He puts it on. It’s way too big for him. YOUNG FLINT (CONT’D) It fits perfect.

The world needs your originality, Flint. You just have to grow into it. And I know that you’re gonna do big things someday.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 4. Flint gives her a smile and hugs her, inspired.

Flint draws a poster of himself in the lab coat with the words “BEST INVENTOR EVER.” He slaps it on the wall. Then he runs out of the house and up into his tree house where he starts on a new project.
From that moment on, I was determined to invent something great. VIDEO DIARIES: We see Flint and some of his many inventio through the years...
Remote Control Television! He pushes a button. The TV gets up and walks over to Tim the couch, who clicks it on...
Eventually. Then the TV quickly KICKS down the door and runs away ami frightened pedestrians.
Hair unbalder! Flint pours a hair tonic on Tim’s head. Hair POOFS out suddenly, completely covering his face like a wolfman. Ti and Flint SCREAM.
Flying car! A car with rockets attached shoots off from the docks, bu dives straight down into the water.
Monkey Thought Translator.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 5. In his father’s tackle shop, Flint shows off STEVE, a ver monkey with a device strapped to his chest and head.
Hungry! How wise-- No, Steve! No, Hungryhungryhungryhungry! no, no, no-- Steve goes on a rampage, knocking over shelves, scaring customers, and pulling a chunk of Tim’s moustache off.
Rat-birds. (TO RATBIRDS) Hey, what’s going on, little guys-- RAT-BIRDS, half-rat, half-parrot, all-disturbing, escape a cage and terrorize the townspeople, including EARL, the town cop.
Flint Lockwood!

head_text.subj: ON A MAP OF THE ATLANTIC

text: My dream was to help my home town, a tiny island hidden under the ‘A’ in Atlantic... ZOOM IN to see the island is barely visible under the “A”
Wide on the rundown town. The cannery is abandoned and in disrepair.

...called Swallow Falls. We were famous for sardines. Until the day the Baby Brent Sardine Cannery closed for good, right after everyone in the world realized that sardines are super gross. Soon, all of us were stuck eating the sardines that no one else wanted. INSERT SHOTS of sardines, prepared in different unappetiz ways.
Poached, fried, boiled, dried, candied, and juiced. (MORE )
Life became gray and flavorless. But when all seemed lost, I stared at defeat... TIGHT on Flint’s face, eyes widening:

...and found hope. TITLE CARD: CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS. INT. FLINT’S LAB - DAY We see a shadowy figure walking through an awesome, futuristic lab full of glowing lights and machinery. This grown-up FLINT LOCKWOOD, still in his labcoat, still wear those spray-on shoes. He stops to look at the posters of great inventors on a wall just like in his old bedroom 15 years ago.
My name is Flint Lockwood, and I was about to invent a machine that turns water... into food. He turns into the light, dramatically.
Steve, my best friend and trusted colleague! Reveal a STEVE the MONKEY. His thought translator contraption says:
Steve.
Can I count on your help? Steve holds up a sardine can, offering.
Can.
I knew I could! This initiates an AWESOME BUILDING MONTAGE! Exciting MUSI Flint pushes a button.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 7.
Button on. He starts a reel to reel recorder.
Memory activate. He draws blueprints.
Blueprints... awesome! He creates a contained NUCLEAR EXPLOSION.
Begin nano-mutation. He lowers a disco ball into a microwave.
Radiation matrix secure. He uses a computer mouse.
Computer, boot! He draws sci-fi lines on the machine.
Coolness enhancement complete! EXCITING MUSIC STOPS. Flint and Steve SIP COFFEE on a bre
Engage coffee break. Long beat, then... MUSIC’S BACK! Flint plugs in two cords.

Networking power grid! He then plugs many cords into many surge protectors and p the last one into the finished machine, clearly made out colander, microwave, blender and other spare parts. But i also looks kind of cool.
Beginning conversion of water into food.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 8. Flint pours water into the top.
Hydrating protein matrix. He flips switches and turns knobs on the machine.
Calibrating flavor panel. He tightens a screw on the bottom of the machine.
Priming Chow Plopper. He types into his computer.
Uploading cool machine voice.
Cheeseburger. He flips on a switch and

Everyone is going to love this. Flint waits hopefully as the Chow Plopper bulges bigger a bigger... A cheeseburger-shaped CLOUD forms slowly above plate at the bottom, becoming more and more like a real cheeseburger. It’s at 60%... 70%... 80%... 90%... A HUGE SPARK shocks Flint!

Aaaaaaaah! Almost instantly, a power surge goes up through the cable and out the lab. Power goes out. INT. TIM’S LIVING ROOM - MORNING Tim sits on the couch, reading the paper. All the applian EXPLODE at once. Black.
Power’s out on Tim’s house and Flint’s backyard LAB which an enormous metal version of his childhood treehouse lab.
Sorry, Dad! INT. FLINT’S LAB —- CONTINUOUS On his way out, Flint passes Steve, who bangs a pipe agai a metal bucket.
Steve, keep working. HUMMING AN IMAGINARY SOUNDTRACK (the same as the full orchestra one playing in the previous scene), Flint runs to a vault-like door and puts his hand up to a fake looki scanner.
Scanning hand. Making his own sound effects, he presses a button and the door opens into a large empty hallway. Approaching the doorway at the other end, Flint inputs the code on his Si
(BEEPING NOISES)

After a few more of his own sound effects he opens the do to the elevator and heads down. EXT. FLINT’S LAB - CONTINUOUS FLINT makes ELEVATOR NOISES as he heads down the pneumati tube elevator from the top of his lab to the ground. The tube goes under the ground and then pops up inside a Port Potty. Flint exits and runs over to the house while still humming the imaginary soundtrack. Neighbor kids watch and laugh, including CAL, 8.
That's a really weird dude.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 10. INT. TIM’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Flint enters through the back door.
Reenergizing power unit. (SOUND
Flint opens the FUSE BOX. Twiddles... Lights go ON. Tim i behind him, arms crossed. Flint turns and is surprised.
Yah! Jeez. He backs into the fuse box and FALLS DOWN. He pops back u and starts to leave, nervously.
See you, dad. EXT. TIM’S BACKYARD - CONTINUOUS Flint goes back out towards his lab. Tim follows outside, where Steve bangs on stuff.
Flint, um... er... don’t you think it’s time to give up this inventing thing and get a real job? Fint stops.
No, why?
Well, all your technology stuff, it just ends in disaster.

The ratbirds, yes, they escaped and bred at a surprising rate, but I took care of that problem and disposed of them. Behind Flint, three RAT-BIRDS descend, pick up a neighbor kid, and fly away with him, SCREAMING.
Billy, just play dead!  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 11.
Flint, you don’t keep throwing your net where there aren’t any fish.
What?
I want you to work full time at the tackle shop.
The tackle shop?! Aww, Dad, no!
Tackle is a good career. As Flint pleads with his dad, Steve climbs up on Tim’s shoulder and reaches for his moustache. Tim’s uncomfortab

Please, I’m so close with this one. I just have to hook it up to the power station and give it more power and it’1l work, and then you can sell food in the shop, and then everyone won’t have to eat sardines anymore. It is going to be so awesome. Tim removes Steve and DROPS him. Time to lay down the law
I’m sorry, son.
Ouch.
No more inventing. Tim turns to go inside.
Dad. I know I can do this. (THEN) And Mom did too. Tim freezes but doesn’t turn. Flint looks at him guiltily He knows he crossed the line.
It had been almost ten years since mom died, and Dad still didn’t understand me like she did.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 12. Flint tries to take back what he said.
Dad, I--
Come on, let’s open the shop. And he walks off. EXT. TACKLE SHOP —- DAY Tim excitedly unveils an “AND SON” sign added to “TIM'S SARDINE BAIT & TACKLE”.
Tim and Son Sardine Bait and Tackle. You feelin’ it?
(TRYING) Mmm-hmm. Tim walks in, happy, as he enters the store and Flint MOP and he follows him inside.
A cartoon baby tips over a wagon of sardines.
Look out, Baby Brent!
Uh-oh!
Baby Brent Sardines.
Hand-packed in Swallow Fall-- The crude animation of the commercial freezes and the MAY walks in front of the frozen image.

As your mayor, I know it's time to put our sardine canning past behind us. And look to the future: Sardine Tourism!  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 13. A cheesy graphic: “TOURISM!” over four different crappy shots of town.

That's why without consulting anyone, I spent the entire town budget on the thing that is under this tarp. Which I will be unveiling today at nooon! Featuring a live appearance by Baby Brent himself--! Another cheesy graphic spins at camera: “NOON!”

Reveal we are watching the Mayor’s commercial on a TV in shop as Flint stacks Baby Brent Sardine cans listlessly. is not wearing his labcoat. There are a couple old-timers (JOE TOWN and RUFUS) in the shop eating sardines, also watching the TV. Flint sighs. “BABY” BRENT enters. Flint’s longtime bully, and the town only celebrity, Brent has let himself go. He’s overweight lazy, and wears a baby blue track suit with “BB” embroide on it. He has a lady on each arm.
What is up, everybody?
Hey! / Hey, it’s Baby Brent!
(TO FLINT) Whatcha doin’? Stacking cans with me on ‘em as a baby? Uh- oh! He does the Baby Brent pose, knocking over some of the ca Flint just stacked. The old timers love it, LAUGHING.
(ANNOYED) Hi Baby Brent.

(LAUGHS) Anyways, who wants to watch me cut the ribbon at the Mayor’s unveiling thing? I’11l be using these bad boys to help save the town. He shows off a pair of huge golden scissors. Joe Towne an Rufus OOH.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 14.
Boy-yo! (AS HE EXITS) Alright you guys! Sardines! Yeah! Swallow Falls Forever!
Oh, what a rascal. Flint frowns as he watches Brent and his posse exit past window. Tim approaches Flint from the back room as the Old-Timers leave.
Listen, you, uh... Maybe you wanna go to that unveiling? Flint thinks for a beat. Then:
(CASUAL) You know, Dad, why don’t you go ahead. I’11 hold down the fort here.
(PLEASANTLY SURPRISED) Really? You sure you can handle it?
Yeah, Dad, I’m pretty sure I’1ll be fine.
Huh. Alright, then. I‘1l be back in half an hour, skipper.
Okay, byeeee. Tim leaves. Flint looks around sneakily then runs away HUMMING HIS SOUNDTRACK again. He grabs his lab coat on th way out.
Backstage, the Mayor grabs the chain link fence, tense. Brent sits behind him, eating sardines out of a tin.
This hell hole’s too small for me, Brent. I want to be big. (MORE )

I want people to look at me and say, “That is one big mayor.” That’s why this has to work. It has to work! Otherwise, I’m just a tiny mayor of a tiny town full of tiny sardine-sucking knucklescrapers. Brent’s knuckles are scraping the ground, mouth full of f
But not me, right?
Oh, not you, Brent, no. You've always been like a son to me. The Mayor rolls his eyes.

The Mayor bounds on stage and up to the microphone. MAYOR (CONT’D) (POSITIVE) Hey, hey everybody! REVEAL there are like 20 people there. MAYOR (CONT’D) Under this tarp is the greatest tourist attraction ever built by humans! REVEAL Flint and Steve tiptoeing towards the power statio carrying his machine.

It just needs seventeen thousand more gigajoules. Go, go, go, go, go, go, go! Flint makes a break for it but is STOPPED immediately by EARL, an overzealous cop who plays by the rules. He hides the machine behind his back.
What are you doing, Flint Lockwood?
Just holding my hands behind my back respectfully, sir.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 16.
You know what you are, Flint Lockwood?
No.
A shenaniganizer! A tomfool! You see my beautiful angel son, Cal? Cal is there. And he brought his attitude.
‘Sup.
I love him so much. This is my only son. I want him to have a bright future. A future in which you don’t ruin our town’s day with one of your crazy science doodley- bopper thingies.
Well, you know, that’s all behind me-—
You see this contact lens, Flint Lockwood? He holds a contact lens.
Mm-hmm.
This contact lens represent you.
Alright.
And my eye represents my eye.
Okay. He very deliberately puts the contact on his eye.
I got my eye... on... you.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 17.
Oh, my gosh, a jaywalker.
Hey! Earl RUNS down the street and tackles the jaywalker. OOF!
And I've arranged for live coverage from a major network and their most experienced professional reporter!
CHYRON: Yesterday
Oh, just send the intern.
A cute young intern, SAM SPARKS, delivers coffee to the c members on set. The PRODUCER and PRODUCTION COORDINATOR stand in the foreground.
She’s cute and she’s super perky.

Well, those are the only things we look for in a TV weather person. Intern! How would you like to do a weather report from a rinky-dink island in the middle of the ocean as a favor to my cousin? Sam, excited, drops her tray of coffees on the ground.
Really?!
Sam drives the weathervan, with her silent but adept cameraman MANNY in the passenger seat.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 18.
Can you believe it, Manny? Temporary professional meteorologist. Woo! Manny holds the wheel as she gestures.
Sam and Manny are sitting in their van as it travels on a ferry across the ocean.

Okay, Manny what about this? (PRACTICING) Welcome, America, I’m Sam Sparks. Hello, America, Sam Sparks here. America, hi, I didn’t see you there. It’s me, Sam Sparks. (THEN, EXCITED) On my way! Across the ocean!
AT THE POWER STATION, Flint creeps past DANGER! ELECTRICI signs. The Mayor DRONES ON in the background.
Now, when she gets here, I want to see a lot of smiling faces... Flint looks up at the huge, scary electrical tower.
This is a great idea.
ON TV: The WNN logo.

Weather news network. Weather news happens... or not. The well-coiffed WNN ANCHOR speaks to camera. INSET is Sa in front of the growing crowd at Swallow Falls’ town cent  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 19.

Now we’re over to Swallow (WHISPERING UNDER Falls where our intern is on ANCHOR) her first day on the job. Or Hello, America, I’m Sam should I say first gray on Sparks. Hello, America, I’m the job, looks pretty cloudy Sam Sparks. there, intern? Beat. Sam is extremely nervous.
Hello, Sam Sparks, I’m America. It’s Swallow Falls degrees... and, uh, let’s just go to the mayor. She gestures to the mayor, who addresses the excited crow

Thank you and welcome national television audience! AT THE POWER STATION, we sees QUICK CUTS of Flint connect lots of jumper cables together on the electrical tower. We PAN UP to the top of the electrical tower over scary zapping coils to find Flint at the very top STRUGGLING to connect one last cable -- and he’s ELECTROCUTED and falls the ground.

And now, here to cut the ceremonial ribbon, Swallow Falls’ favorite son, Baby Brent! Brent walks on stage from behind a curtain and RIPS OFF h tracksuit, revealing a DIAPER. MAYOR (CONT’D) He’s still got it, folks!
Yeah! Hahaha! I’m the best person in the whole town! The crowd APPLAUDS. He makes his SIGNATURE POSE, knocking over a wagon of sardines, and the crowd goes nuts.
Uh-oh!  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 20. BACK AT THE POWER STATION, we see run back to his machine He raises the jumper cables high, about to attach them...
Food synthesis go! ON EARL in the crowd with his WIFE and son CAL. Suddenly jolts to attention. He looks down.
My chest hairs are tingling. Something’s wrong. Earl acrobatically flips away toward the power station. ON THE MAYOR.

So here it is, the attraction the whole world has been waiting for-- SardineLand! Brent cuts the ribbon with the giant scissors and the tar falls, revealing a small Sea World-like THEME PARK. Applause. ON THE ATTRACTIONS as each tarp falls. MAYOR (CONT’D) With rides! And exhibits! And featuring Shamo! The world’s largest sardine, and his flaming hoop of glory! Amid a few rides and booths is SHAMO, a TINY FISH in a VE LARGE BOWL, with a ring of fire to jump through. Shamo do not look excited about the ring of fire. MAYOR (CONT’D) Those of you in the Splash Zone, look out! ON JOE TOWNE in the front row of the bleachers, where ONE SEAT is marked “SPLASH ZONE.”
Yeah! ON EARL, doing OVERZEALOUS ACTION COP POSES. He sees Flin and GASPS. ON FLINT, who finally connects the cables to the machine.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 21.
Cheeseburger. It starts to power up and Flint looks excited.
Flint Lockwood! Flint turns and sees Earl running.
Uh, just a second! I’m in the middle of a yaaaaah! A SPARK sends the machine SHOOTING off horizontally like missile, with Flint dragged behind it, hanging on to jump cables for dear life.
Yeeeeeeeeeeeaaaaghgh! ON MANNY AND SAM, broadcasting, unaware of the danger.

Well, looks like things in Swallow Falls are sardine to get better. For-- WHAM! The machine knocks Manny’s camera into Sam, Flint flies over. The lens smooshes right up against her face. She looks ridiculous.
The Anchor looks at Sam’s smooshed face in shock.
Aah!
Flint looks back as the machine rockets him away from Sam

Aah, sorry! The machine (and Flint) whips into Sardine Land, knocks around out Shamo’s fish bowl scaffolding, and ricochets b  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 22. And time SLOWS DOWN as the machine and Flint pass by Tim. Tim SCOWLS. Oops. Flint STRUGGLES to stop the machine by planting his feet, waterskiing on his spray-on shoes, tearing up the sidewal and is finally stopped by a STOP sign. The machine breaks away from the jumper cables and shoots disappearing into the sky. Flint looks up at the machine lost...
No... OOF! And he’s tackled by Earl.

You're under arrest, Flint Lockwood. Thank goodness you only caused minimal damage to SardineLand. But behind them, there’s a noise. They both look at Shamo bowl scaffolding... KRAAAAAAK! The scaffolding breaks, the fish bowl topples over and SPLASHES its water everywhere but the Splash Zon

Oh, come on! The bowl starts to roll around the town like a giant whee desruction. ON THE SARDINE MUSEUM, which is SMASHED by the bowl. ON THE VIRTUAL SARDINE EXPERIENCE. People lie down in it like sardines as the lid is rolled up over them. The bowl SMASHES into it. ON THE MAYOR, as the bowl smashes into the stage and send him FLYING.
Aaaaggh! ON SHAMO, screaming inside the bowl. ON THE CROWD, fleeing. ON BRENT, running with the giant ceremonial scissors.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 23.

I really shouldn't be running with these! Flint and Steve RUN as the bowl bears down on them, but t aren’t fast enough and give up -- only to be saved when t lip of the bowl rolls over them, leaving them unharmed.

Run, run, run, jump, jump, run, run, jump! ON THE BOWL, as it continues on its path of destruction through Sardine Circle and people run SCREAMING. THE BOWL bounces through a parking lot, exploding a car w propels the bowl up in the air and throws Shamo through t flaming hoop and towards the ocean and freedom

(GURGLY) Yippee! Then he’s immediately SNATCHED UP by a flying ratbird. Then the bowl falls back to the ground, landing upside-do on top of Flint and Steve, trapping them inside. THROUGH THE GLASS BOWL, Flint sees all the destruction he caused.
(DEFEATED) Ay papi. Everyone stares at Flint. The Mayor. Brent. Cal and Earl. All incredibly angry.

(MUFFLED THROUGH GLASS) Flint Lockwood! Then Flint sees a disappointed Tim. He looks at his dad, full of regret. Everyone turns their back on Flint, last all, Tim. Flint hits his head against the glass in despai Then... CRAAAACK! It sends a crack up to the top of the b and the whole thing shatters. Everyone turns and GASPS. Flint and Steve stare at the crowd, then quickly run away

We find Flint, with Steve, hanging on the ladder at the e of the docks, hiding underneath. He SIGHS.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 24. He hears footsteps, and hides... It’s Sam, who walks to t end of the dock and SIGHS. She tosses her microphone ANGR into the water. Then she PLOPS down, and her heels kicks Flint in the eyes.
Ow!
Oh my gosh! I am so sorry. Are you okay? I didn’t get a chance to--
It’s okay. It’s just pain.
Sorry, I am not myself today. My whole career was ruined by some crazy jerk riding a homemade rocket. Flint looks away suspiciously.
Wait a minute. (THEN) What is going on with your feet?
Spray-on shoes. They don’t come off. She grabs his foot and yanks it toward her until he’s han upside down.
Cool! This could solve the untied shoes epidemic. What are they made of, some kind of elastic bio- polymer adhesive? Music plays as Flint gets all dreamy.
(SMITTEN) Yeah, exactly...
(SUDDENLY NERVOUS) I mean... (GIGGLES) Wow, they’re shiny. (THEN) I’m Sam. She lets go of his foot and his head slams into the ladde again, causing him to YELP.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 25.
(IN LOVE) Flint.
Steve!
(EXCITED AGAIN) Is that a monkey thought translator?
Steve.
Ha! Incredible! Flint is just staring at her enchanted, DREAMY MUSIC playing...we can barely make out Sam putting it all toget
(DISTORTED) Did you make all of this stuff? (THEN, REALIZING) You hit me with the rocket! MUSIC STOPS. Flint’s caught.
You kicked me in the face!
I said I was sorry!... SPLAT. Some yellow goop lands on the ladder. Steve licks Flint SNIFFS it and is about to taste when ZING! A PICKLE SLICE lands in the water. Sam notices none of this.

Oh! Do you know how hard it is to break into the weather game? I spent my entire life building up to that moment. You get one shot at the show... ZING! Behind Flint, something lands in a garbage can on t docks, causing it to rattle. Flint gets up and walks to i

(REALIZING SOMETHING’S AMISS) ..-And if you don’t make it, it’s back to cleaning the barometers... Flint looks into the garbage can. There’s a SLICE OF CHEE inside. He reaches for it.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 26.
Cheese? Suddenly a ratbird appears from the shadows of the can, startling Flint. It snatches the cheese and flies away.
Aaaah! Flint starts to piece it together.
But that could only mean... ROLLING THUNDER causes Flint to turn and look up at the s
Sam turns and reacts in the same way.
Steve does the same.
All over town, people turn to the sky and react.
Rufus takes off his hat, a woman takes off her glasses, J Towne takes off his beard.
Earl, in his cop car, turns, rolls down his car window, t  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 27.
Back on the dock:
We finally reveal beautiful burger-shaped clouds dropping perfectly-prepared chesseburgers into the ocean and along dock. It’s RAINING CHEESEBURGERS!!!!
Happy! Cheeseburgers! Jump! Excited! Flint stares to the heavens and LAUGHS as beautiful burge float down all around them. A burger lands in his hand. H takes a delicious bite.
My machine works... It really works! Sam overhears and approaches.
Your machine? Is that what that rocket was?
(MOUTH FULL) Uh... Do you like it?
(MOUTH FULL) I love it! (LAUGHS) This is just amazing! Look at this. This is the greatest weather phenomenon in history! Flint is happy. Then, he realizes:
(MOUTH FULL) Hey, aren’t you a weathergirl?
Sweeping shot over the town as burgers rain down.

Manny, get your camera! People slowly come out of hiding and start to enjoy the delicious burgers. All except -- Tim, who stands inside the doorway of his shop and just stares at the sky in disbelief. Back in town, people CHEER!
The WNN Anchor touches his earpiece, getting a message fr his producer.
This just in, our humiliated weather intern is apparently back for more.
IN CAMERA: Burgers rain behind an excited Sam.

Thanks, Patrick. Okay, everybody. You are not gonna believe this one, but I am standing in the middle of a burger rain. You may have seen a meteor shower, but you’ve never seen a shower meatier than this. On Flint, surveying the scene, as Sam continues behind hi The town is going crazy with the burgers.
For a town stuck eating sardines, this is totally manna from heaven.
This tastes significantly better than sardines! Cal shoves one into his mouth and ENJOYS IT. We see the Mayor steal burgers from people as he walks.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 29.
This is gonna be big! The mayor shoves three burgers into his mouth. A crowd gathers to watch Sam’s report as they eat.
This food-weather was created intentionally by meekish backyard tinkerer, Flint Lockwood. Earl and everyone around him STOPS.
Flint Lockwood? Everyone turns and looks at Flint.
Hi. Earl jumps over to Flint and tackles him again. OOF! The burgers STOP RAINING.
You’re under arrest for ruining Sardine Land. But before he can cuff him... Sam runs up.
Flint, those burgers were awesome! The producer called and he was all like (DEEP VOICE) “Everybody loves that food weather.” The Mayor apporoaches, excited.
Food weather.
What?
This could be even bigger than Sardine Land.
Can you make it rain food again? Please?  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 30.
No--
Well, I don’t really know if I-- Cal runs up.
You're gonna do it again?
Oh, you gotta be kidding.
Please please please please please... Flint looks at her. God, she’s adorable.
Yes.
INT. TIM’S LIVING ROOM - MOMENTS LATER Tim blocks the way to the port-a-potty.
No.
Dad, just give me one more chance.
We both know this was an accident.
I know, but--
Cheeseburgers from the sky, that’s not natural.
My invention could save the whole town. You would be so proud of me, Dad. Plus, (WHISPERS) there’s a girl here.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 31.
(SIGHS) Can you look me in the eye and tell me you’ve got this under control, and it’s not gonna end up in a disaster? Tim raises his unibrow so that his eyes are visible.
(LOOKING AWAY) Yes? Not good enough. Flint strains to look him in the eye, bu his eyeballs wander and twitch. Finally he gets his eyes his dad.
(SUPER-FAST) Ivegotthisundercontrol- anditsnotgoingtoendupindisaster. (WHEW)
Unibrow back down.
Alright.
Thanks, Dad!
Oh, sure. Flint calls over to Sam.
Okay. So, Sam. (OPENS THE PORT-A- POTTY DOOR) This is where the magic happens. Sam and Manny exchange a look.
Sam and Flint and Steve and Manny are there. Manny has hi camera pointed at an uncomfortable Flint. Steve licks Sam microphone.
Lick... lick... lick... lick... This happens for a while.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 32.
The curtain opens and they step into the MAIN CHAMBER. Sa is a little weirded out.
Welcome, Flint.
Wow. You seriously spend a lot of time alone.
What? (AWKWARD LAUGHING)
Flint shows Sam a diagram of the machine.
So here's how it works: Water goes in the top and food comes out the bottom.
So when you shot it up into the stratosphere, you figured it would induce a molecular phase change of the vapor from the cumulonimbus layer?
That’s actually a really smart observation.
(SUDDENLY NERVOUS) I mean, the clouds probably have water in them, which I guess is why you shot it up there in the first place.
(SUDDENLY NERVOUS) Right, right. That's why I did that...on purpose.
Right, yeah.
Right. Both LAUGH AWKWARDLY and Flint backs out of frame.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 33.
Flint points to a diagram of water molecules forming into hexagons from radiation waves.
The machine uses a principal of hydro-genetic mutation. Water molecules are bombarded with microwave radiation, which mutates their genetic recipe into any kind of food you want.
So, pizza?
Yes.
Mashed potatoes?
Yes.
Peas?
Yes, that’s also a food.
Steak?
Yes.
Apples?
Mmm-hmm.
Applesauce?
Yes.
Can it do a B.L.T.?!  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 34.
(KINDLY) I’m pretty sure I said any kind of food.
Chicken wings?!
Okay, well, just think about what you're saying and if it’s a food, then yes it can.
Baloney?
That is a food. Sam gets a dreamy look in her eyes.
Ooh... How about Jell-o?
(FLIRTS BADLY) Do you like Jell-0?
I love Jell-o.
I love Jell-O too! And peanut butter, right?
Oh, no, no. I am severely allergic to peanuts.
(LYING) Yeah, me too!
So what’s it called?
Peanut allergy.
No, the machine.
Of course. It’s called the Flint Lockwood Diatonic Super Mutating Dynamic Food Replicator. (MORE )
Or, for short, (DRAMATIC TURN) the FLDSMDFR.
Fldsmdndffursur?
Fldsmdndffursur?
Oh. (THEN) Manny, make sure you get this, he’s going to make the food now.

Uh, now? (CAUGHT) Well, the thing is, I can’t... (GETS IDEA) wait to show you this hilarious internet video! Flint clicks his mouse and distracts Sam with a YouTube v -- A CUTE CAT DJ playing “Fight the Power.”
What? What is this...? (LAUGHING) It’s so cute... As Sam watches, laughing, Flint -- in QUICK CUTS -- rigs remote control system using a SATELLITE DISH and a bunch wires.
(WHISPERING) Pushing. Folding. Connecting. Taping. Turning. Painting. Switching. Staring. Motivating. Placing button. He sets up a RED “SEND” BUTTON, and re-boots the computer Sam's still laughing.
I can’t believe I’ve been watching this for three hours!
I know!
Flint types at his computer. Sam comes over, still laughi Flint finishes his typing and the central screen now read “ENTER FOOD CODE:”
(SOTTO) It’s working. (THEN) What do you guys want for breakfast? Steve pops into frame.
Gummi Bears.
Whoa, Steve, no! We both know how you get around Gummi Bears.
How about... eggs?
And toast?
Orange juice.
And bacon! Flint very subtly leans in and closes his eyes, thinking might get a kiss.
What are you doing?
Nothing. (THEN) To the computer! Flint types the food code into the computer.
So, you're sure this is safe?

Don’t worry. I have a Dangeometer that lets us know if the food is going to over-mutate. REVEAL a “DANGEOMETER” GAUGE with a needle safely in the green. Pay no attention to the yellow or red. come back later. That won't  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 37.
Ooh, what happens if the food over- mutates?
I dunno, but that’1l never happen. (THEN) All right. This probably won't explode.
What? Flint pushes the RED SEND BUTTON. WE TRAVEL past the butt to the Dangeometer, along wires to the satellite dish and into the--
Where the machine floats peacefully. An 8-bit graphic of bacon strip pops onto the VIEW SCREEN.
Bacon. We ZOOM inside the machine to see the molecules re-formin into little molecular bacon strips.
Sam stands in front of a map with food-weather symbols.
Well, those cheeseburgers were only the beginning, because a breakfast system is on its way to Swallow Falls. My forecast: sunny... side up. MONTAGE MUSIC CUE: SUNSHINE, LOLLIPOPS by Lesley Gore.
CLOUD’S EYE VIEW of Breakfast raining on Swallow Falls.

Joe Towne leaves the tackle shop to catch SUNNY SIDE UP E A woman catches PANCAKES on a plate while she drives to w  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 38. A little girl tilts orange juice caught in an upside-down umbrella into the mouth of a gurgling little boy. The Mayor rips open a storm drain on the side of a buildi and bacon pours into his mouth. Ratbirds snack on breakfast foods on a powerline. Flint watches happy breakfast eaters. The mayor walks up, covered in bacon.
Flint, my boy, can you do lunch?
It’s raining sandwiches. The Mayor is eating and pacing. Brent holds up flashcards to illustrate the Mayor’s point kind of like Bob Dylan, but not really.

Alright, here’s the skinny. You keep making it rain the snackadoos, weathergirl provides free advertising, I have taken out a very high interest loan to convert this po-dunk town into a tourist foodtopia. All you have to do is make it rain food three meals a day, every day, for the forseeable future, and in thirty days, we hold a grand reopening of the island as a must-see cruise destination, and everyone everywhere is going to love your invention. He has a flashcard of people hugging a stick-figure Flint has a big smile and hearts all around him.
You think so? The Mayor takes this opportunity to eat the sandwich out Flint’s hands.
(MOUTH FULL) I know so. INT. FLINT’S LAB - DAY Flint types the menu into his computer and SLAPS the butt  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 39.
Sam does another weather forecast. A woman catches a turk leg on her way to work.
Now that’s what I call poultry in motion.

The Mayor munches on a ham hock as he points offscreen. The “FALLS” in the “SWALLOW FALLS” sign on the cannery is detonated and replaced so that it now reads “CHEWANDSWALL The buildings get facelifts: “Gas Station” becomes “Anti- Tablets.” Stores become “Nothing but Floss,” “Bibs.”
In JUMP CUTS, to camera:
Mr. Lockwood, may I please have waffles?
Falafels.
Jelly beans.
Avocado! Flint writes down their requests.
Coming right up!
Sam reports in front of piles of food on the ground.

Leftovers? Not a problem with Flint Lockwood's latest invention, the Outtasighter. So named because it catapults uneaten food out of sight, and therefore, out of mind.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 40. Flint and Steve are inside a fantastical contraption. Its huge fork and spoon arms SCRAPE leftovers onto the giant plate, which drops it into the bowl in the back. He pulls lever and the bowl CATAPULTS the food way into the distan

The Baby Brent Sardines billboard is replaced with one fo “Flint Lockwood Brand Napkins.” Brent GASPS in horror. People eat from mouth funnels, and we see the mouth funne store in the background. A RAINBOW OF JELLYBEANS rains into the open mouths of wai kids.
Jellybeans! / Awesome! Throughout, people keep ordering more food and the music faster and faster.
Pizza!
Donuts! We follow a DONUT that falls from the sky and into Cal’s mouth.
Pie!
Gummi bears! Flint gives him a stern look.
Fish!
Chicken pad thai. Flint typing. Flint hitting the button.
(DEMANDING FOOD WALLA) Pizza / bologna / I want/ gimme/ more/ come on! / etc... Suddenly the MUSIC completely CUTS OUT. ON THE MAYOR, who is now really FAT.
A pizza, stuffed inside a turkey, the whole thing deep fried and dipped in chocolate. (BEAT) It’s me, the Mayor.
Oh... uh, you look different. Did you get a new... haircut?
Yes, I did. Thank you for noticing. The music comes back in. ON FLINT TYPING. ON MORE FOOD FALLING. The Foodster RATTLES and SHAKES with overuse.
(FOOD WALLA)
EXT. TACKLE SHOP —- DAY 41. Across the street from his dad’s shop, Flint looks on. People walk past the shop window, laughing and eating the falling food.
I love ya, son.
I love spending time with you, dad. Inside, the shop is completely quiet and empty. at the counter, alone. Tim stands
Tim changes a sign from “SARDINES 10% OFF” to “SARDINES 1 OFF.” Flint enters.
Hey Dad. I’m headed back the lab. If you wanna come I could show you how I make the food... Tim hides the sign.
Eh, no thanks. That techno-food. It’s too complicated for an old fisherman.
Got it. Flint turns to leave.
Could still use your help around here, though, you know.
I’m working with the mayor now, Dad. I mean, the town’s grand reopening is in, like, a week.
Right. Got it. Flint leaves. INT. FLINT’S LAB - MOMENTS LATER Flint adjusts the angle of the satellite. SFX: DOORBELL. It’s Earl.
(OVER INTERCOM) Flint Lockwood! EXT. TIM’S BACKYARD - NIGHT Earl stands outside the PORT-A-POTTY, hat in hand. A hatch opens on the side of the lab, and Flint sticks his head o
Yeah?  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 43.
Uh, it’s my son Cal’s birthday tomorrow and I was just wondering if you could make it rain something special.
Well, I’m pretty backed up on requests. Plus, you’re always mean to me.
It'd be just one time. For my special angel’s special day.
Uh, I don’t know. You know, I don’t want to overwork the machine, so...

Okay. I knew it was a long shot... I just wanted Cal to see how much his father loves him. I thought you would understand. You know how fathers are always trying to express their love and appreciation for their sons. This hits Flint hard. Then:
Earl, wait. Flint closes the hatch, runs over to the Dangeometer and it’s almost into the yellow. Uh oh! Wait-- he taps it and the needle moves barely back into the green.
Phew.

(COPYING) Phew. Then Flint runs off. Steve, copying Flint, taps the gauge STEVE (CONT’D) Touch, touch, touch. The needle moves back into the yellow! EXT. FLINT’S LAB - CONTINUOUS Then WE SEE Flint’s silhouette coming down the pneumatic elevator. He opens the PORT-A-POTTY.
I’ve got an idea.
A ratbird perched on a wire COCK-A-DOODLE-DOOS. INT. CAL’S BEDROOM - MORNING Cal wakes up and rushes to the window. It’s snowing... beautiful, colored snowflakes. Could it be?
Whoa! REVEAL Earl and his wife, REGINA, watching proudly from t door.
Happy Birthday, son.
Dad...?
This is your day. Go have fun. Cal rushes down the hallway...
I love you guys! You’re awesome!
I love you, too, son!
Have a good time, baby! Cal opens the door and out into--
A GLORIOUS LANDSCAPE covered with 31 different flavors of CREAM. Cal and every kid in town burst out of their house
ICE CREAMIIIIILILi2))birt Cal leaps headfirst into the snow and makes a face-down s angel, MUNCHING ice cream.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 45.
Yeah! Cool! ON A NEAPOLITAN ICE CREAM FIELD, where chocolate and vani are covered with kids. One WEIRD KID runs into the strawberry.

Strawberry’s my favorite! ON KIDS finishing a SNOWMAN, DEVOURING IT, then repeating ON THE BOWL OF THE OUTTASIGHTER, where kids have climbed The plate drops scooped-up ice cream into their mouths an then catapults both ice cream and kids into the distance.
Yeaaaahh! ON EARL AND CAL, on their roof, getting on a sled.
C'mon, Dad.
I don’t know, Cal. This doesn’t look saaaaaffffel!!!! Too late. Cal pushes off and they swoosh down into an ope DUMPSTER full of ice cream. They LAUGH.
I love you, son.
I know, dad. You tell me every day. ON FLINT, watching them with envy. He SIGHS. Sam approaches.
Flint this is amazing! And designing the ice cream to accumulate into scoops? I don’t know how you’re gonna top this!
Maybe with hot fudge? He LAUGHS awkwardly. She doesn’t. Then, Cal and a bunch o kids call from afar.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 46.
Hey Flint, you wanna be in a snowball fight with us? Flint steps back, afraid.
Flint, what's the problem?
I’ve never actually been ina snowball fight.
Really?
I don’t even know the rules. Is there like a point system, or is it... to the death?
No-- You’ve never-- I mean look, even Steve is throwing chocolate snowballs. Steve THROWS what look like chocolate snowballs. A beat a Flint and Sam look on uncomfortably.
Oh.
Hmm.
Yech.
(PICKS UP SNOW) So, like this? He throws a snowball, weakly.
No, harder than that.
(REALIZING) Oh. We ZOOM IN on his face as he gets a smile and his eyes brighten. He starts throwing snowballs as hard as he can.
Snowball! Snowball! Snowball!  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 47. He pelts Cal, an old man, and a child, knocking them over
Well, there’s something to be said for enthusiasm. Sam watches, happy for Flint, as he joyfully wails on different members of the town.
Snowball! Snowball! Snowball!
Flint runs into a house and nails a dad reading the paper
Snowball! .«+.a little girl and boy in a bedroom...
Snowball, and snowball! KIDS’ MOM (0.S.) Kids? What’s going on? ...and their mom in the hall.
Snowball! Flint runs back out into the street, chased by the kids.
Snowball! Snowball!
Still at snow day, Sam reports.

I scream, you scream, we all scream for Flint Lockwood's latest tasty town-wide treat, with flurries of frozen fun on what the mayor declared to be an ice cream snow day.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 48.
On the JUMBOTRON, Sam continues her report.

He’d also like invite everyone in the world to catch a cruise liner and come on down this Saturday for the grand opening of Chewandswallow, a town that is truly a la mode... PARIS: People watch Sam on a TV at the Eiffel Tower.
(DUBBED FRENCH) ...a town that is truly... a la mode... EGYPT: People watch Sam in front of the PYRAMIDS.
(DUBBED ARABIC) ...a town that is truly... a la mode... LONDON: Crowds watch Sam in front of BIG BEN.
(DUBBED BRITISH ACCENT) ...a town that is truly... topped with ice cream.
Sam continues to report, as everyone has fun.
...with today's scoop for the Weather News Network, I'm Sam Sparks! We can hear Cal in the distance.

Flint, this is the best breakfast ever! INT. FLINT’S LAB - NIGHT Flint is sitting on his bed, tapping his foot, thinking H Then he looks up with an innocent smile and SNAPS with bo hands! Eureka!  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 49.
(GASP) That's it!

Flint on his computer “HOW TO TALK TO GIRLS”; Flint in a romantic scene with Steve in a blonde wig making the monk “oo 00” mouth; Standing by the button-pusher which pushes button; holding the phone nervously, staring at a notepad Lots of crumpled pieces of paper are around.
Researching! Role-playing! Dialing! Waiting! RING, RING, RING. Nervous noises from Flint.
Sam answers her phone.
Sam Sparks.
Hanging up! Flint slams the phone down.
Regretting! Re-Psyching! Saying what I’m doing!
(ANSWERS PHONE) Flint?
(READING, INTO PHONE) Hi Sam how are you that’s nice I was wondering if you would like to go on ad... activity with me tomorrow?
(INTO PHONE) Um, okay.
Great bye meet me in the forest! (HANGS UP) Nailed it.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 50. He walks out of the lab excitedly.
Gotta go, Steve. Keep an eye on the lab for me! Unseen by Flint, Steve sits by the Dangeometer, which is the yellow. He smashes an ice cream cone on his head.
Steve.
Flint and Sam walk along a grassy hill. Behind them, unnoticed, the WALKING TV runs by.
Where are we going?
Oh, nowhere, I just thought it’d be nice for the two of us to... go on a walk together. Like you do... as friends. (FAKE) Oh my, what’s that? Sam stops in her tracks.
Wow... REVEAL an enormous yellow/orange JELL-O MOLD, refracting setting sun like a stained-glass castle. It’s breathtakin
Oh, Jell-O'’s my favorite.
You never made a request, so, I made one for you. Flint disappears into the Jell-O. Sam looks confused.
Flint? Flint?
Join me. His arm pokes out of the Jell-O. He PULLS her inside.

Whoa!  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 51. INT. JELL-O MOLD, BALLROOM —- CONTINUOUS SCLURP! Once inside, she tries to gain her balance on the squishy Jell-O floor, then realizes she’s in a beautiful O cathedral.
(AMAZED) Who-oooa. But, how did you...?

Oh, I just made it rain Jell-O in the middle of the night, then I gathered it all up with the Outtasighter before everyone woke up and then I brought it here and pressed it into a gigantic custom- carved plastic tupperware mold I made. No big deal. Flint is playing a Jell-O piano.

Everything's made of Jell-O. This piano, those sconces, that ghetto blaster, that Jell-O, that aquarium, that Venus de Milo with your face on it next toa Michelangelo’s David that also has your face. Sam gives a weirded-out look. Flint does several high vertical bounces.
Come on, Sam, what are you waiting for? She looks at the EXIT sign. What will she do?
Nothing! She suddenly does a bunch of fast little manic jumps.
Woooo! Yeahhhhhhhh!!! Boing, boing, boing!

Flint and Sam bounce around the room like crazy.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 52. Sam pushes Flint down the Jell-O stairs and he laughs and bounces. ON MICHELANGELO'S DAVID. They both fly in and take bites of it. Both jump in and out of frame making goofy poses. Sam jumps off the balcony onto a diving board, then lands a Jell-O SWIMMING POOL.
Cannonball!!!
(RIGHT BEHIND HER) Bellyflop! He smacks on the surface. SLAP! OW!
Why did I do that?
Sam and Flint watch the sun set through the refracted lig of the Jell-O wall. Long beat as Flint is nervous.
So, Jell-o.
Right, right, right.
It’s a solid, it’s a liquid, it’s a visco-elastic polymer made of polypeptide chains but you eat it-- (CATCHES HERSELF) I mean... it tastes good. (GIGGLES)
(CONFUSED) Why do you do that?
Do what?
Say something super smart, and then bail from it?
Can you keep a secret?  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 53.
No. (OFF LOOK) But this time, sure. Yeah.
Okay, well, it was a really long time ago, but I too was... a nerd.
Too? START FLASHBACKS: Young Sam (glasses, ponytail) in her bedroom staring at a poster of a Doppler.

When I was a little girl, I wore a ponytail, I had glasses, and I was totally obsessed with the science of weather. Other girls wanted a Barbie, I wanted a Doppler Weather Radar 2000 Turbo. But all the kids used to taunt me with this lame song. It wasn’t even clever! Young Sam, finishing an equation, is mocked in class.
Four eyes! Four eyes! You need glasses to see! BACK TO SCENE: Flint tries not to laugh at “glasses to se
(STIFLES LAUGH, THEN, OFF HER LOOK)
Go on. Sam looks annoyed. Then she continues.
So I got a new look, gave up the sciency smart stuff, and I was never made fun of again. And I still need these glasses, but I never wear them.
I‘1l bet you look great with glasses on.
Oh, I’m really not-- He grabs her glasses and starts to put them on her.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 54.
And on they go. SAM’S P.O.V. -- as her glasses go on, a blurry handsome g becomes a sharply in-focus, nerdy Flint.
Whoa.
What?
Nothing.
Wait. He quickly carves something out of Jell-O and turns to he
It’s a Jell-O scrunchie. He puts her hair up in a ponytail.
And now, the reveal. Her MAKE-UNDER complete, he gazes at the new nerdy Sam.
Wow. I mean, you were okay before, but now... you’re beautiful.
No, I’m not. I can’t go on out in public like this.
Well, why not? I mean, this is the real you, right? Smart, bespectacled... who wouldn’t want to see that?
(CHARMED) You know, I’ve never met anyone like you, Flint Lockwood.

(CHARMED) Me either. But about you. Sam closes her eyes and leans in for a kiss. Flint stares her nervously.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 55. He closes his eyes, puckers, then puffs his cheeks out in I’'ve-never-kissed-a-girl way. They’re mere inches away w Flint’s cell PHONE RINGS -- it’s his voice singing: “FLIN

text: Is your phone ringing?
That’s weird. Someone must have changed my ring. (LOOKS AT PHONE) Oh, it’s the mayor. Do you mind if I take this?

No, no, no. Go ahead, take (COVERS PHONE) I’m so sorry. it. That's fine, really. I It’s just really important. should be going too, it’s I’m just going to step getting late. outside real quick. He walks through the wall and FALLS. Sam cringes as he la with an OOF.
OMINOUS LOOKING CLOUDS. CRANE DOWN to reveal the facade o the Bibs store. Tim waits there for Flint, wearing a TIE, clearly uncomfortable. Flint runs in, excited as hell.
Dad, you came! I had the best day I have so much to tell you!
Do I look alright?
You look great, come on let’s go! Flint drags him off.
The Roofless, a fancy restaurant with a crowd WAITING. Br is in line at the velvet rope.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 56.
Oh, it was so cool, I almost kissed a girl-- (GREETING PEOPLE) Hey. How’s it going? Brent argues with the BOUNCER.
It’s Baby Brent. You know? “Uh- oh!” I should be on the list! Flint and Tim go straight to the front.
Hey, Brian. The Bouncer lets them ENTER. Brent watches, horrified.
(NEAR TEARS) WHAAAT?!?! You’re letting that guy in? That guy’s a nerd!! The door closes in Brent’s face.
It is raining steaks. There is no ceiling.
Hey, Flint Lockwood!
Oh, thank you. Thanks so much.
A toast! To Flint and his delicious steaks.
Oh, thanks. Thank you. Oh, wow.
(UNCOMFORTABLE) Very nice place.
Salt, pepper. Pepper, salt.
Flint Lockwood! Earl puts out a fist for Flint to hit, and he slaps it 5.
Earl! 57. As Flint and Tim sit down at their table, Tim notices the absence of any ceiling.
So, no roof?

Yup. You just hold out your plate. And I even made it rain your favorite: meat. Mmmmm. Tim looks around the room as -- CLANK, CLANK, CLANK -- la steaks hit the tables all around them, rattling silverwar Everyone else enjoys it, but Tim is a bit freaked out.

Okay. So, you know how the grand reopening of the town is tomorrow? Well, the mayor has asked me to cut the ribbon. He said my invention saved the town! Aren’t you proud of me?" Tim looks torn. Then-- SLAM! A large steak lands Tim’s plate, STARTLING him. He looks down at it. He looks at Flint, who’s still celebrating, arms in the air, and does want to have to burst Flint’s balloon.
Well... Doesn’t this steak look a little big to you?
Yeah, it’s a big steak. Every steak is not exactly the same size. Did you even hear what I just said? WHAM! Another big steak lands between them, knocking thei glassware off the table.
Son, look around. I’m not sure this is good for people. Maybe you should think about turning this thing off.
It’s making everybody happy. Everybody except you. (MORE )
When are you going to accept that this is who I am instead of trying to get me to work in some boring tackle shop? Flint gets HIT by a steak.

Well, you seem like you know what you're doing, then. I guess I'll just get out of your way. Tim heads off. The steak falls off Flint’s head. EXT. TIM’S TACKLESHOP - LATER CLOSE ON a fish being ground up into chum. REVEAL Tim, alone, working the chum grinder. He pauses to SIGH, then continues grinding. EXT. TIM’S TACKLESHOP - SAME Hot dogs rain down. One hits the “And Son” Tim tacked ont the tackle shop sign and knocks it to the ground.
Flint walks down the street, muttering.

There’s no pleasing that guy. He just wants to take anything good I do and just smoosh it-- Aaaah! A THREE-FOOT LONG HOT DOG plops down in front of Flint. H looks around to see several other large hotdogs around hi neighborhood, including his dad’s yard, which is full of hotdogs.
These are big hotdogs. He looks up to the clouds, grave. INT. FLINT’S LAB - MOMENTS LATER Flint looks at a scanner with a huge HOT DOG in it.  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 59.
Oh, man. (DEEP BREATH) I mean, this isn’t that bad, is it, Steve? Steve has smeared mustard on his face and hands.
Yellow. Flint goes over to the Dangometer which is in the yellow.
You're right, Steve. The Dangometer is in the yellow. I don’t know what to do. He hears a WHIRRING SOUND and turns to see...
I do... declare these hot dogs to be delicious! The Mayor, now GROTESQUELY FAT, riding in from the shadow a RASCAL SCOOTER and munching on a HOT DOG piled with FOO
(FREAKED OUT SOUND)
Whoa. Steve runs away.
How did you get in here?

Tomorrow’s the big day, Flint. The entire town’s fate is resting on your food-weather! I’m thinking pasta. Some light apps. I know you won’t let us down. He wheels back into the shadows, still staring at him.
Well, Mr. Mayor, I think there’s something you should see. The mayor returns.
What?  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 60. Flint leads the mayor over to the scanner, and pulls up a display on the computer monitor.

This is the molecular structure of a hot dog that fell last week. And this is the molecular structure of a hot dog that fell today. He pushes a button, revealing a very scary looking rapidl moving group of molecules.

The machine uses microwave radiation to mutate the genetic recipe of the food. The more we ask it to make, the more clouds it takes in, the more radiation it emits, the more these food molecules could over-mutate. I think that’s why the food is getting bigger.
Here’s what I heard: blah blah blah, science science science bigger. And bigger is better. Everyone’s gonna love these new portion sizes. He shoves the entire hot dog in his mouth and swallows it
(MOUTH FULL) I know I do. Flint looks over to the button, unsure.
My dad thinks I should turn it off...
Geniuses like us are never understood by their fathers, Flint.
But what if things go-- The Mayor starts circling FLint.
Who needs the approval of one family member when you can have it from millions of acquaintances? (MORE )

Not to mention that little cutlet Sam Sparks... and me? I’ve always felt you were like a son to me, Flint.
